description: Configuration for running a suite of filesystem tests

has_directory_size_limit.description: True if the filesystem has a directory size limit (unrelated to available disk space)

in_memory.description: True if the filesystem is an in-memory filesystem

is_case_sensitive.description: True if the filesystem is case sensitive

is_journaled.description: True if the filesystem implements journaling and can recover from sudden failure

is_slow.description: True if the filesystem is a slow filesystem, in which case some tests are tweaked so they can complete on time

library.description: Dynamic library that contains the filesystem definition; see memfs for an example

options.description: A list of test options to be applied to the filesystem

description.description: Name given to this set of options

use_fvm.description: True if FVM should be used

sectors_per_cluster.description: If set, the sectors_per_cluster value to use when formatting a FAT filesystem

supports_fs_query.description: True if the filesystem supports fuchsia.fs/Query

supports_fsck_after_every_transaction.description: True if the filesystem supports the fsck_after_every_transaction mount option

supports_hard_links.description: True if hard links are supported

supports_resize.description: True if the filesystem can expand in size when used within a volume manager like FVM

supports_sparse_files.description: True if the filesystem supports sparse files

supports_watch_event_deleted.description: True if the filesystem supports the WATCH_EVENT_DELETED event

use_directory_admin_to_unmount.description: True if the DirectoryAdmin protocol (legacy) should be used to unmount
